organization.fullName: General Hospital of Shenyang Military Region

identificationModule.briefTitle: Endovascular treatmenT for Acute Ischemic Stroke in China
identificationModule.officialTitle: Endovascular treatmenT for Acute Ischemic Stroke in China: a Retrospective, National, Multi-center, Registry Study

responsibleParty.investigatorAffiliation: General Hospital of Shenyang Military Region

leadSponsor.name: General Hospital of Shenyang Military Region

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This is a retrospective real world registry study, aiming to explore the effectiveness and safety of endovascular treatment of acute ischemic stroke in a Chinese population.

interventions.name: endovascular treatment
interventions.description: all enrolled patients must receive endovascular treatment.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of patients with modified Rankin Score (mRS) 0 to 2
primaryOutcomes.description: the minimum and maximum values of mRS are 0 and 6, respectively; higher mRS mean a worse outcome

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Changes in National Institute of Health stroke scale (NIHSS)
secondaryOutcomes.description: the minimum and maximum values of NIHSS are 0 and 42, respectively; higher NIHSS mean a worse outcome

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of patients with modified Rankin Score 0 to 2
secondaryOutcomes.description: Proportion of patients with modified Rankin Score 0 to 2
Distribution of modified Rankin Score after treatment
sICH was defined as 4 or more increase in NIHSS caused by hemorrhage

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of intraparenchymal hemorrhage (PH1 and PH2)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Proportion of intraparenchymal hemorrhage (PH1 and PH2) after treatment
edema is determined by middle shift.

eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: all patients must receive endovascular treatment regardless of the time from onset to treatment.

locations.facility: Department of Neurology, General Hospital of Northern Theater Command
